title: Implement Focusgroup MVP
description: Full implementation of focusgroup v0.1 - a tool for gathering feedback from multiple LLM agents on CLI tools designed for agent use. MVP scope: Claude + OpenAI providers, docs-based and CLI subprocess modes, TOML config, JSON/markdown output. First target: memex.

title: Phase 1: Foundation
description: Project scaffolding and core infrastructure. Create pyproject.toml with dependencies (typer, httpx, anthropic, openai, pydantic, rich). Set up src/focusgroup package layout. Implement CLI skeleton with Typer. Add TOML config loading with pydantic validation. Create session logging infrastructure.

title: Set up pyproject.toml with dependencies
description: Create pyproject.toml with: typer, httpx, anthropic, openai, pydantic, rich, tomli. Configure uv for package management. Set up src layout entry point.

title: Create package structure
description: Create src/focusgroup directory structure: __init__.py, __main__.py, cli.py, config.py, session.py. Create subdirectories: agents/, tools/, modes/, output/, storage/. Each with __init__.py.

title: Implement CLI skeleton with Typer
description: Create cli.py with Typer app. Commands: 'focusgroup run <config>', 'focusgroup ask <tool> <question>', 'focusgroup agents list', 'focusgroup logs list/show'. Set up __main__.py to call CLI.

title: Implement TOML config loading
description: Create config.py with Pydantic models for: SessionConfig, AgentConfig, ToolConfig, QuestionConfig. Load and validate TOML files. Support both session configs and agent presets.

title: Create session logging infrastructure
description: Implement storage/session_log.py for saving session transcripts. Store in ~/.local/share/focusgroup/sessions/. Include session ID, timestamp, agents, tool, questions, responses. JSON format.

title: Phase 2: Agent Providers
description: Implement agent abstraction and provider integrations. Create Agent protocol/base class. Implement Claude API integration (anthropic SDK). Add Claude CLI wrapper for authentic agent behavior (subprocess claude command). Add Codex CLI wrapper for authentic Codex agent behavior (subprocess codex command). Implement OpenAI Agents API integration. Build agent registry and discovery system.

title: Create Agent protocol and base class
description: Define Agent Protocol in agents/base.py with: name, provider properties; respond(prompt, context) async method; stream_respond(prompt, context) async iterator. Create AgentResponse dataclass with content, model, tokens_used.

title: Implement Claude API agent
description: Create agents/claude.py with ClaudeAPIAgent class. Use anthropic SDK. Support model selection, temperature. Implement respond() and stream_respond(). Handle API errors gracefully.

title: Implement Claude CLI wrapper
description: Create ClaudeCLIAgent in agents/claude.py. Invoke 'claude -p <prompt>' via subprocess. Parse JSON output. This gives authentic Claude Code agent behavior including its system prompt and tools.

title: Implement Codex CLI wrapper
description: Create agents/codex.py with CodexCLIAgent. Invoke 'codex' CLI via subprocess. Parse output. This gives authentic Codex agent behavior as implemented in the OpenAI Codex CLI tool.

title: Implement OpenAI Agents API integration
description: Create agents/openai.py with OpenAIAgent class. Use openai SDK. Support model selection (gpt-4o, etc). Implement respond() and stream_respond(). May need to explore OpenAI's Agents API for optimal integration.

title: Build agent registry and discovery
description: Create agents/registry.py. Register agents by provider name. Load agent presets from ~/.config/focusgroup/agents/*.toml. Provide get_agent(provider, mode, **config) factory function.

title: Phase 3: Tool Integration
description: Implement tool abstraction and integrations. Create Tool protocol/base class. Build CLI tool wrapper (run commands, capture stdout/stderr). Implement documentation extractor (--help parsing). Add memex-specific integration for initial testing.
close_reason: Implemented Tool protocol, CLITool wrapper, docs parser, and MemexTool

title: Create Tool protocol and base class
description: Define Tool Protocol in tools/base.py with: name property; get_help() -> str async; run(args) -> ToolOutput async; describe_interface() -> str async. Create ToolOutput dataclass with stdout, stderr, exit_code, duration.

title: Build CLI tool wrapper
description: Create tools/cli_tool.py with CLITool class. Run arbitrary CLI commands via asyncio subprocess. Capture stdout/stderr. Support timeout. Return structured ToolOutput with exit code and duration.

title: Implement documentation extractor
description: Create tools/docs_tool.py. Extract help text by running '<cmd> --help'. Parse man pages if available. Format documentation for agent consumption. Support custom help arguments per tool.

title: Add memex integration for testing
description: Create memex-specific tool config. Test focusgroup against memex CLI (mx command). Create example session config targeting memex. Verify end-to-end flow works with real tool.

title: Phase 4: Session Modes
description: Implement session orchestration and modes. Create single question round mode (one question, all agents respond). Build free-form discussion mode (agents see each other's responses). Implement structured phases mode (exploration → critique → suggestions → synthesis). Add optional moderator synthesis agent.
close_reason: Phase 4 complete: session modes (single, discussion, structured), orchestrator, and moderator synthesis

title: Implement single question round mode
description: Create modes/single_round.py. Ask one question, collect all agent responses in parallel. Wait for all responses before continuing. Simple mode for quick feedback on specific questions.

title: Build free-form discussion mode
description: Create modes/discussion.py. Agents can see and respond to each other's responses. Support multiple rounds of back-and-forth. Allow agents to build on or disagree with others. Configurable round limit.

title: Implement structured phases mode
description: Create modes/structured.py. Four phases: 1) Exploration (what do you see?), 2) Critique (what's wrong?), 3) Suggestions (how to improve?), 4) Synthesis (key takeaways). Phase-specific prompts guide agents.

title: Add optional moderator synthesis
description: Create modes/moderator.py. Optional synthesis agent that runs at the end. Summarizes themes, conflicts, and consensus across all agents. Produces executive summary of feedback session.

title: Implement session orchestration
description: Create session.py with Session class. Coordinate agents, tool, mode, and moderator. Handle session lifecycle: init -> run questions -> optional synthesis -> save log. Provide progress callbacks for UI.

title: Phase 5: Output and Polish
description: Final output formatting and CLI polish. Implement JSON output writer for machine-readable results. Build Markdown report generator with agent quotes and themes. Add session log storage and retrieval commands. Create quick 'focusgroup ask' command for ad-hoc queries. Add example config files.
close_reason: Phase 5 complete: Implemented JSON/Markdown/Text output formatters, session log CLI commands (list/show/export/delete), ask and run commands, and added 4 example configs

title: Implement JSON output writer
description: Create output/json_writer.py. Write session results as structured JSON. Include: session_id, timestamp, tool info, agent configs, questions, all responses with metadata, optional synthesis. Machine-readable for agent processing.
close_reason: Implemented Phase 5 Output and Polish: JSON writer in output/json_writer.py, Markdown writer in output/markdown.py, CLI commands for logs list/show/export/delete, ask command, run command, and example configs

title: Build Markdown report generator
description: Create output/markdown_writer.py. Generate human-readable report with: session summary, tool description, agent quotes organized by question, theme extraction, moderator synthesis if present. Good for review and sharing.
close_reason: Implemented Phase 5 Output and Polish: JSON writer in output/json_writer.py, Markdown writer in output/markdown.py, CLI commands for logs list/show/export/delete, ask command, run command, and example configs

title: Add session log commands
description: Implement 'focusgroup logs list' to show past sessions with date, tool, agent count. Implement 'focusgroup logs show <id>' to display full session transcript. Support filtering by date/tool.
close_reason: Implemented Phase 5 Output and Polish: JSON writer in output/json_writer.py, Markdown writer in output/markdown.py, CLI commands for logs list/show/export/delete, ask command, run command, and example configs

title: Create focusgroup ask command
description: Implement quick ad-hoc query: 'focusgroup ask <tool> "question"'. Use default agent panel (configurable). Single question mode. Output to stdout immediately. Good for quick feedback without config files.
close_reason: Implemented Phase 5 Output and Polish: JSON writer in output/json_writer.py, Markdown writer in output/markdown.py, CLI commands for logs list/show/export/delete, ask command, run command, and example configs

title: Add example configs and documentation
description: Create configs/examples/memex-review.toml as working example. Add agent preset examples. Update CLAUDE.md with usage examples. Ensure tool is self-documenting via --help.
close_reason: Implemented Phase 5 Output and Polish: JSON writer in output/json_writer.py, Markdown writer in output/markdown.py, CLI commands for logs list/show/export/delete, ask command, run command, and example configs
